overview: This capstone subject brings Music Studies students together to plan, develop and present a creative plan and grant proposal. Through workshops, guided group sessions, and in-class discussions, students learn to work collaboratively by developing and refining their creative vision for a performing arts project.
The capstone experience culminates in a project plan, comprising an overview and strategy for practical implementation, and a grant proposal, which includes a financial plan and case for support.
intended learning outcomes: propose and develop a concept for a performing arts project;
apply industry-standard management principles to a project plan and simulated grant proposal;
work collaboratively and constructively within a team to foster creativity and generate innovative solutions;
critically reflect and self-assess contributions to a group creative planning process.

assessments.timing: Second half of the teaching period

assessments.description: Project plan supported with a 200-word personal reflection. 1600 words (equivalent)
Hurdle requirement:. Students must attend a minimum of 75% of all scheduled classes.

Semester 2.Contact hours: 24 hours, comprising one 2-hour class per week.

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
